title: Why is Ivern such a terrible champion?
body:
I know they have some changes on the PBE for him, but they aren't significant changes that are going to affect him. They're too small and way too late.

Now, before you go and post "Ivern is not a bad champion!" Let's be reasonable here. This champ has the lowest win rate in ranked play in the game clocking in at 40%.

Source: http://na.op.gg/statistics/champion/

And his win rate is terrible based on number of games played too, so don't go arguing that he's hard to master, but once you master him, he's good because that's not true either.

Source: http://champion.gg/champion/Ivern

He
Is
A
Bad
Champion

There is a spike in win rate for the 5-15 games played with him that quickly falls off, but the spike is probably due to all the ELO you're losing by playing him, so you get matched with weaker opponents.

He'll eventually receive enough numerical buffs that will allow him to become a huge part of the meta.

Bard was buffed significantly before he became even viable. Not sure about Taliyah; I think that was because no one knew how to use her W before it got changed to vector cast (which ironically made it weaker).

As for Ivern, give him some time. If you paid any attention to op.gg's stats, you'll notice that his 40% win rate is diluted by a terrible win rate in an off-role (support). His jungle win rate is 46.77%, which is rather low but at least acceptable for a champion that was just released this patch. Champion.gg cites a 48.14% win rate for his jungle (and an abysmal 26.19% win rate for support) with an average games played of 4.14, which is pretty good for a champion so complex on the macro level that it changes the way players play the game.
